website_summaries.verdict: In a pinch, this Dremel set will handle light router jobs. But accuracy suffers due to the Dremel tool itself, and the bits dull quickly. Experienced users recommend upgrading to a proper router.
pros: Fits the Dremel router table and drill press well
check for fit on other Dremel tools
Works best on inlays and surface detail work, as well as soft woods
Users feel the bits get the job done, if not much more
cons: Bearing-less bits tend to heat up when working with harder materials, sometimes burning the wood or formica

customer_reviews.title: Buy a real router and bits for hard woods.
customer_reviews.text: The bits cannot handle harder woods like oak or maple. No matter what speed and how slow they just start smoking the wood. Even with the router bit table jib, the cuts were very uneven. Softer wood is ok
customer_reviews.author: RYANH

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why dremel sells router bits that aren't the proper length for the router base they sell, but the main reason I'm giving a poor review is the bits' tendency to walk itself out of the chuck while being used. I have the right collet and it's as tight as I can make it, and it still creeps out digging into my project and gouging it. Absolute garbage from an otherwise very dependable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew E McBride

customer_reviews.title: hey it works!
customer_reviews.text: works like a charm. next best thing to a true router. it's only 1/4 inch in diameter so keep that in mind when consider this for the project you are planning. I used it to route a circular recess to fit a speaker magnet in a box a made too shallow. it worked but it took a bit longer than it would have if I had used a real router, but the box was already installed in the wall and a full size router would not have fit. the dremel and this router bit did the trick magnificently.
customer_reviews.author: Sasquatch

customer_reviews.title: I paid $30 for what?...
customer_reviews.text: Got these because they fit my Dremel. Wow, what a waste of money... Get the cheap ones that are knock offs. If the quality was there, I would get it. But it's not. Straight garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Kasper

customer_reviews.title: Good Router Set
customer_reviews.text: I used three of the tools in the set, with my Dremel Tool plunge router set and I was amazed at how well the bits routed the soft pine I was working with. The bits are not carbide, so expect them to dull quickly if used on hardwood. You can't route as quickly as a large 1 hp, or more powerful router, but for small hobby crafting they are excellent. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: G. Shrader

customer_reviews.title: Not working that great for me
customer_reviews.text: Not working that great for me. Not sure if it's me (I'm decent with all my other tools) or these tools seem to only work on small detail projects. Definitely not a replacement for a real router.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Rejas

customer_reviews.text: Works great and super easy to use. I love the Dremel and all the accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Product was exactly described. Perfect for my situation and has been working well since I got it. I would buy this item again and recommend if to my friends. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Lady_Giorgio

customer_reviews.title: Good bits
customer_reviews.text: The bits work well in my Dremel. They seem durable and very sharp and hopefully will last
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: These bits work okay but not great. The provided carrying case is also no more ...
customer_reviews.text: These bits work okay but not great. The provided carrying case is also no more than thin plastic packaging and was easier to lose than the bits themselves. I quickly relocated the bits to a different case.
customer_reviews.author: sbbutkcin

customer_reviews.title: Wish they had bearings
customer_reviews.text: I wish some of these (the rounded edge and chamfer) had a bearing so they wouldn't burn wood.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Skip it.
customer_reviews.text: Barely sharp enough or sturdy enough for hardwoods. Dremel accessories can't provide enough support for proper routing. Get a palm router, and skip this.
customer_reviews.author: Elnrik

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bits get dull a little too quickly but other that that they function fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baby router
customer_reviews.text: These can’t really hold a candle to a real router. They’re fine for very small projects and details but if you need to do any serious routing like rabbets or cutting the bits and the dremel motor don’t really cut it (literally).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Tested each bit out on some pine I ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Tested each bit out on some pine I had laying around. Only issue I have is the Dremel tool/bits don't have good depth adjustment but it isn't that significant an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Larsen

customer_reviews.title: I only use the 2 straight pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I only use the 2 straight pieces. The dremel tool is a bit flimsy to be used as a router
customer_reviews.author: Clarence M Ross Jr

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived fast. Went to use the first bit out of th pack and it snapped off. Was cutting into white wood that was clear and speed was set accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: William McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but fair
customer_reviews.text: While other rotary routing bits are available at better price, these get the job done well.
customer_reviews.author: Brett S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent idea, but it only last 15 inches and burn the first router bit drill
customer_reviews.text: Excellent idea, I'm dissapointed of Dremel. I use the smallest router bit for a 15 inches long piece of wood, the idea was to insert a small piece of thin triplay (3mm) and the drill get burn and broke it. I had to finish the work with the carbure bit, so the router bits are kind of cheap things.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I turned my Dremel tool into a mini router with this set. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: piefoot

customer_reviews.title: I've already found a ton of projects to use these ...
customer_reviews.text: I've already found a ton of projects to use these on. All pieces work well, just need to be gentle - definitely not using a full-size router.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very practical attachments
customer_reviews.text: I have purchase this set to help me with a number of projects and tasks that often are time consuming. Let me give you one example: A project to replace 10+ doors. Mounting the doors requires small adjustments, often you need to chisel a bit more the sections where the hinges or latch will go on. That is a tedious process. With these attachments, specifically the straight-plunge attachment, you can quickly make these types of adjustments. I have used the other attachments to improve the look of wooden shelves, with very good results. However I wouldn’t recommend these for heavy duty work, it is just not made to meet that goal. Small work, quick fixes, something fast, yes.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: but the Dremel router attachment that works awfully bad.
customer_reviews.text: the problem isn't the bits, but the Dremel router attachment that works awfully bad.
customer_reviews.author: Ido D.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time, as I did. Buy a router,as I finally did.
customer_reviews.author: J & P Contrades

customer_reviews.title: I am not having much success using my dremel with ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not having much success using my dremel with these attachments as a light-weight router...........perhaps it is simply my technique, but doesn't seem to be working for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Hood

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I was making a Wooden heart for my sister's daughter. I needed some new routing bits to be able to cut the wood down. I took a chance on these and couldn't be happier. They are sharp and haven't had any problems with them. I'll buy them again once I wear them out!

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used these enough to really judge longevity, but they've worked supremely well so far. At first use, I didn't tighten the bit well enough and it climbed out. For the cost and experience so far, I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great bits of luck
customer_reviews.text: Love most all things Dremel. Replacing kit and accessories lost in fire damage.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I received it on time and it's what I wanted

customer_reviews.title: They work very well
customer_reviews.text: Best price I found on these items and they work as advertised.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little set of bits
customer_reviews.text: Most of these work really well with the router table accessory. I have noticed that cutting slots you need to do them starting out at a low cut depth and gradually raise it and swipe your work again. Other than that, the only other thing is that these don't have a bearing guides, just a flat top if it applies to the type of bit. They still work though, just don't rush the job.

customer_reviews.title: Glad to be able to find these
customer_reviews.text: Glad to be able to find these. Getting ready to retire and I needed these for some of my projects.

customer_reviews.title: Good bits, fast shipping, easy to set-up and use
customer_reviews.text: No real complaints about this set. I'm very amateur at wood working and everything was easy to use. Mostly used the rounded tip for routing letters in red oak. Experienced some burning which is probably user error. Only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is that the router bits are TINY...I know it's a Dremel bit set, but they are TINY.

customer_reviews.title: just ok
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Dremel 3000 series. I used it with the router table attachment as well and found that these bits work with soft, thin wood only. I would recommend these bits for smaller projects.

I thought I was OK when I saw that the one bit I was interested in, the "615", was in the set, but it turns out that the one I need is called "TR615". This naming is really confusing and could have easily been avoided.

product_meta.title: Dremel 692 6-Piece Router Bit Set
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
A valuable addition to any woodworker's Dremel rotary tool, the Dremel 692 6-Piece Router Bit Set includes six high-speed router bits made from high-grade steel. Conveniently packaged in a reusable plastic case, these bits are ideal for routing, inlaying, and mortising wood and other soft materials. Ideal for a wide range of light to medium hobby, repair, and renovation jobs, this set ensures that you have the exact bit you need to tackle your next project.



High-Speed, Durable Steel Construction to Tackle a Range of Jobs
Made of high-speed, durable steel, these bits are the ideal size for rotary tools. The straight bits offer exceptional versatility, and the piloted edge bits help you add a personalized, detailed touch to wood frames, molding, and more.

Quality Construction for Precise Cuts the First Time
Designed for use with the 335 Plunge Router and 231 Shaper/Router attachments, these bits feature high-quality construction that allows you to make exceptionally precise cuts the first time, saving you energy and stress. They're also well-suited for detailed work, such as building and sanding dollhouse furniture, model trains, or miniature buildings and planes.User-Friendly Design and Easy Insertion Process for Longer Life
Incredibly easy to use, these bits work best when inserted all the way into the tool and then backed out slightly before tightening down. This insertion process provides plenty of shank for the collet or chuck to hold the bit in place. For optimum precision and longer life, it's also important to secure objects to a stable surface while working--if chattering occurs, simply increase the speed. It is also important to keep a light touch so the speed of the tool, not the strength of your arm, does the work.

Variety of Bits for a Range of Projects
This set comes with a total of six bits, including a 3/32-inch piloted beading bit, 1/4-inch core box bit, and 1/2-inch chamfer bit that all work well for inlaying and mortising wood and other soft materials.

About Dremel: A History of Brilliance and Innovation
Founded in 1932 in Racine, Wisconsin, Dremel is the industry leader in rotary tools. The company owes its success to the inventive genius of its founder and namesake, Albert J. Dremel. In his lifetime, Mr. Dremel owned 55 patents on a wide range of products from electric erasers to a gas-powered rotary lawn mower. His most famous and important invention was a high-speed rotary tool, dubbed the Dremel Moto-Tool. Compact, lightweight, and perfect for a wide range of jobs, the rotary tool was an immediate hit with hobbyists and eventually became accepted as one of the greatest inventions of the 20th century. Today, the Dremel name remains synonymous with utility, durability, and innovation.

What's in the Box
One 612 piloted beading router bit, one 615 corner rounding router bit, one 650 1/8-inch straight router bit, one 654 1/4-inch straight router bit, one 617 core box router bit, and one 618 chamfer router bit




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Six piece router bit set, includes: (#612) routing bit, 3/32-inch piloted beading works well for inlaying, and mortising in wood and other soft materials, constructed of high speed steel. (#617) router bit, 1/4-inch core box works well for inlaying, and mortising in wood and other soft materials, constructed of high speed steel. (#618) router bit, 1/2-inch chamfer works well for inlaying, and mortising in wood and other soft materials, constructed of high speed steel. (#615) routing bit, 1/8-inch piloted corner-rounding works well for inlaying, and mortising in wood and other soft materials, constructed of high speed steel. (#650) routing bit, 1/8-inch straight, high speed steel, for routing, inlaying and mortising in wood and other soft materials. (#654) routing bit, 1/4" straight, high speed steel, for routing, inlaying and mortising in wood and other soft materials.
feature_bullets: Rout, edge, inlay, and mortise in wood
Ideal for a wide range of hobby, repair, and renovation jobs
Do not run in excess of 30,000 RPM
